meanings.definition: To involve in conflict or difficulties.
meanings.sent1: The argument between the siblings embroiled the entire family in chaos.
meanings.sent2: The political scandal embroiled the nation in controversy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten embroiled itself in a tangle of yarn.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to quit her job embroiled her in a whirlwind of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected snowstorm embroiled the town in a blanket of white.

meanings.definition: One who causes trouble or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The troublemaker at school was known as the class embroiler.
meanings.sent2: The gossip spreader was seen as the neighborhood embroiler.
meanings.sent3: The prankster was always the embroiler of laughter during parties.
meanings.sent4: The instigator of the argument was the main embroiler in the group.
meanings.sent5: The trouble-causing squirrel was the little garden embroiler.
